item.title: Kara add a quote by Ransom Riggs
item.description: "I discovered Emerson's soporific qualities by falling asleep with my face in the book, drooling all over an essay called 'Self-Reliance'..." -- Ransom Riggs

item.title: Kara add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "It kills me sometimes, how people die." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Kara add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Kara add a quote by A.A. Milne
Kara add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Kara add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Sobriety is okay enough," Denny says, "but someday, I'd like to live a life based on doing good stuff instead of just not doing bad stuff. You know?" -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Kara add a quote by Paramahansa Yogananda
item.description: "Making others happy, through kindness of speech and sincerity of right advice, is a sign of true greatness. To hurt another soul by sarcastic words, looks, or suggestions, is despicable." -- Paramahansa Yogananda

item.title: Kara add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "When you have your health, you have everything. When you do not have your health, nothing else matters at all." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Kara add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I have enough energy to write with and as that is all I have any business doing anyhow, I can with one eye squinted take it all as a blessing." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Kara add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Kara add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Kara add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Loneliness does not come from having no people about one, but from being unable to communicate the things that seem important to oneself, or from holding certain views which others find inadmissible." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Kara add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Every human life contains a potential, if that potential is not fulfilled, then that life was wasted..." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Kara add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Kara add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "You can't pay a landlord in dogma." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Kara add a quote by Joe Hill
item.description: "You want sympathy, go fuck James Taylor." -- Joe Hill

item.title: Kara add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "At one O'Clock, Miss Celia comes in the kitchen and says she's ready for her first cooking lesson. She settles on a stool. She's wearing a tight red sweater and a red skirt and enough makeup to scare a hooker." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Kara add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Kara add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You have just dined, and however scrupulously the slaughterhouse is concealed in the graceful distance of miles, there is complicity." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Kara add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Kara add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Everybody loves something, even if it's only tortillas." -- Pema Chodron
